Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Drug-Eluting Balloon Angioplasty in Preventing In-Stent Restenosis in Postirradiated Carotid Stenosis

Trial_Design.evidence: In this open-label, randomised controlled trial, 66 patients with severe PIRCS were recruited

Participants.evidence: 66 patients with severe PIRCS were recruited from a single hospital

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to DEB-PTAS (n=30) or conventional PTAS (n=36)

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy and safety of drug-eluting balloon (DEB) angioplasty in preventing ISR in PIRCS.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the degree of ISR at 12 months, assessed by CT/MR angiography.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to DEB-PTAS (n=30) or conventional PTAS (n=36) based on the last digit of their chart number.

Blinding.evidence: Randomisation was not concealed, and blinding was not applied.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 66 patients with severe PIRCS were recruited from a single hospital between July 2017 and July 2021.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The DEB group showed significantly lower ISR (26.58±8.75% vs 45.93±20.86%; P<0.001) and fewer cases of significant ISR (≥50%) (3.4% vs 38.9%; P=0.029).

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were similar between groups.
